title: Face used for Economist
content:
Anyone here read the Economist? I have been for some time and love the face they use for their heads and body copy.   
   
Anyone know what that face is?   
   
BTW, I am refering to the print version - not the web version.   
   
Thanks!   
   
Mike
author: mike gastin

comments.content:
They've been using Officina for a while, but now only for really large settings on the cover, so you must mean the new face for headings: it's a custom version of FF Zine (Spiekermann was involved in the recent redesign). There are some things I love about Zine, but to me it seems to lack some polish.   
   
As for the body text, I think it didn't change with the recent redesign, but I forget what it is. I find it a bit mannered.   
   
hhp
I've red the Economist for quite a while. The text face is different in the redesign. Erik lurks on this forum, he's even posted a few messages awhile back. He is the one to answer this.

The old text face was simply called _Economist_ or _Economist 101_ and was designed, I believe, by Briem. You can see a sample here [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=243431](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221214/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=243431)   
or in the Precision Type Reference Guide (5.0) if you have that at your disposal. The redesigned face is called _EcoType_; it's clearly a derivative of _Economist_, but is a little lighter and slightly more condensed in comparison.   
   
But James is right: Erik is the source.   
   
Jon
